channel.title: Anything wrong with fighting games?
channel.description: I have not been allowed to play non-bloody fighting games and I find it really unfair. When I'm board, I just play a pokemon game like unovarpg (no I'm not a fan of pokemon), but even that isn't allowed.

item.title: Anything wrong with fighting games?
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

When I was young, I was exposed to a then new GTA 2. To me, this game was my life. I’d always had a dream of being a pixelated figure walking around and throwing bombs at random people in 2D worlds, then working for some gangs and exterminating their opponents. After a particularly long night of GTA, I crashed and when I woke up there was a fire outside and people were screaming. Turns out I took some bombs out of my father’s closet while he was asleep and started throwing them at random people while yelling “REMEMBER – RESPECT IS EVERYTHING!”

Read full topic

item.title: Anything wrong with fighting games?
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

Muroth:

Video games that contain fighting doesn’t affect me at all. Grand Theft Auto, I used to play 24/7 and I had no thoughts about killing prostitutes, running over random people, hijacking cars, etc. Some parents are just like that, maybe you could make some sort of deal, like ask if you can play an hour a day, in return you do extra chores or something. Your parents are kind of strict, but only because they don’t want you… murdering someone i guess?

my nephew is 10 and plays it all day and has picked up so many cuss words from it :S

Read full topic

item.title: Anything wrong with fighting games?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

But there is much more harmful content on the internet than there is on a gaming console. I don’t see why it isn’t the other way around, that they let you play games but not on the internet.

Read full topic

item.title: Anything wrong with fighting games?
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

Lets him freely use the internet but restricts what games he plays?
Honestly there’s no problem with playing games like Black Op’s or the modern warefare series but games that swear and have excessive violence like GTA you should definitely not be allowed to play.

Read full topic

item.title: Anything wrong with fighting games?
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Lin:

Nothing at all. I’m sorry, but your parents are idiots. I haven’t known one person in my entire life that was “corrupted” due to the violence in video games. Any kid who “is” was just poorly parented because his parents couldn’t teach him/her right from wrong.

I’m assuming you’re going off generalization. Their not idiots, their just protective of their son and do not want them to experience such violence at such a young age.

Read full topic

[/quote]
They say I’ll become a killer from it. And it’s not my parents, it’s just my mom.[/quote]

item.title: Anything wrong with fighting games?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:20, topic:445817”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=548675.msg4023249#msg4023249 date=1340157950]
The reasoning behind it is that it desensitizes you to whatever the content is. This is proven and not arguable.

The argument is that being desensitized means that you may change your morals or whatever. This changes from person to person, and your parents are just being protective. I wouldn’t say stupid or idiotic, as you are pretty young (no offense), but it’s the same sort of thing we have movie and game ratings for etc. Times have just changes. Would you expect your parents to let you watch porn? I’m sure there are some parents that wouldn’t mind, but the majority of parents would never let you do it willingly. It’s just a standard that’s slowly going in one direction.

PS - If it really is about the blood, most games have mods or options that allow you to turn blood off. This worked for my neighbor (3 years younger than me) whose parents don’t like him playing bloody games.
[/quote]
I don’t think you understand 100%… I’m saying that even a game like dbz or pkmn isn’t allowed.[/quote]Hmm, I dunno. I admit that’s pretty overprotective… ask them specifically why pokemon isn’t allowed

Read full topic

item.title: Anything wrong with fighting games?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:18, topic:445817”]The reasoning behind it is that it desensitizes you to whatever the content is. This is proven and not arguable.

The argument is that being desensitized means that you may change your morals or whatever. This changes from person to person, and your parents are just being protective. I wouldn’t say stupid or idiotic, as you are pretty young (no offense), but it’s the same sort of thing we have movie and game ratings for etc. Times have just changes. Would you expect your parents to let you watch porn? I’m sure there are some parents that wouldn’t mind, but the majority of parents would never let you do it willingly. It’s just a standard that’s slowly going in one direction.

PS - If it really is about the blood, most games have mods or options that allow you to turn blood off. This worked for my neighbor (3 years younger than me) whose parents don’t like him playing bloody games.[/quote]
I don’t think you understand 100%… I’m saying that even a game like dbz or pkmn isn’t allowed.

Read full topic

item.title: Anything wrong with fighting games?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

The reasoning behind it is that it desensitizes you to whatever the content is. This is proven and not arguable.

The argument is that being desensitized means that you may change your morals or whatever. This changes from person to person, and your parents are just being protective. I wouldn’t say stupid or idiotic, as you are pretty young (no offense), but it’s the same sort of thing we have movie and game ratings for etc. Times have just changes. Would you expect your parents to let you watch porn? I’m sure there are some parents that wouldn’t mind, but the majority of parents would never let you do it willingly. It’s just a standard that’s slowly going in one direction.

PS - If it really is about the blood, most games have mods or options that allow you to turn blood off. This worked for my neighbor (3 years younger than me) whose parents don’t like him playing bloody games.

Read full topic
